Reviews.Title: “Good base for sightseeing, close to tubes”
Reviews.Author: lilminx2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband for 4 nights in January, it was our first 'sightseeing' trip to London and the Hyde Park Hotel was a great base, its very close to Queensway which is a good shopping street itself with plenty of shops, restaurants, pubs and two tube stations! Its a small hotel and the staff were friendly and helpful but there were a few negatives, the bathroom was so small we could hardly close the door when we were in as we couldnt squeeze past the sink!! The room was cold, the only source of heat was a small electric heater that they had left in the room for us, our bed was against a window and this probably didnt help! The breakfast was continental, which was grand for us to start the day, the staff leave a tray with cornflakes and a croissant outside your door in the morning. Overall, we didnt pay a lot of money and I feel the hotel was good value, there was a small kitchenette and a TV. An idea base to see London.

Reviews.Title: “a quick weekend break”
Reviews.Author: madosani
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights during september. the hotel was easy to find, with good transport links nearby. The food in the restaurant was of good quality. Staff were very helpful and friendly. would use again for weekend breaks.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, easy with close tube access”
Reviews.Author: maria_barrett
Reviews.Content: Rooms very small and especially the bathroom when staying for more than one night, we stayed three and would have preferred more room for the price. Loved the area we were in though and loved the restaurants and shopping close by, didn't find reception particularly friendly but we loved London and really enjoyed our visit to London, if I return I would definitely try somewhere else in the same location. Could hear a lot of noise from neighbouring rooms during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the tube & near Notting Hill!”
Reviews.Author: Buenog
Reviews.Content: The hotel and the rooms are small but they were quiet and met the needs of room for 3. Reception was gracious enough to let us check in early as it was pouring when we arrived. The value was hard to beat as it is close to the Bayswater Tube and the Notting Hill neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Good Room for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Discerning_Eye_USA
Reviews.Content: Got what I thought was a deal from Easy Click travel for $125.00 (U.S.) a night for a double occupancy. My girlfriend and I showed up to the reception area and a young man, who could not have been older than 22, checked us in. Upon signing for the room I saw that he had placed us on the first floor at which time I asked if he could put us somewhere else. I have this thing about being on the first floor, I am always afraid that we are going to be right near the elevator, or that people coming in late at night are going to pound on our door, or wake us up from being too loud. The young man gave us a room on the fourth floor of a building down the block from the main entrance. It was nice, bathroom seemed pretty modern. There is no place to hang a towel in there, but there was plenty of closet space. There was no elevator in this other building so we had to haul about fifty pounds of luggage up four flights of stairs - no easy task. The young man told us about this before we accepted, but he also said it was a nicer room than the original one on the first floor he had selected for us. The room was made up nicely each day after we left, but what I can't stand was that the maid had turned off the air conditioner off each time after she entered. In a perfect world, housekeeping would leave it alone so that when we come back from a long afternoon of sweating in the streets, we could come back to our nice cool room and not have to wait the couple hours for it to become tolerable again. It must be a law of hotels to do this. They have a computer on the first floor which is free for guests to use. This came in very handy. Also, the concierge at the front, a pretty young lady, was very helpful with stores in the area that could help us, and where we could find things. You should know that this is a very ethnic area of London to reside in. Don't expect to see men in bowler hats and women with Union Jack flag earrings. Instead, expect burkas and full face coverings on women walking around. There is a strong Arabic population and the stores reflect that. None of them seem to serve alcohol. Walking along, you see a lot of juice bars and tea houses. There is one spot where you can get a beer late at night, it is an Austrian bar/restaurant on Bishop's Bridge Road called the Tiroler Hut. We went there after a waitress we met on the street gave us the lowdown on the area. She said to walk down the stairs, grab a beer and settle in for some fun. She was right. They serve good beers out of these huge Bavarian steins. They cost a pretty penny, about $26 U.S. for two. But the entertainment inside is the real gem. The Austrian owner has a karaoke bar complete with an electric keyboard. He sang "My Way" by Frank Sinatra in a thick Austrian accent and then he played a song on his saxophone. It was like a scene out of a David Lynch movie but I would not have traded it for the world. Only in Bayswater Baby! Do yourself a favor and find this place and have as bizarre an experience as we did that will stay with you forever.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneQlder
Reviews.Content: We arrived after 24 hours of flying fairly exhausted to be told at reception that the booking our travel agent had made months before didn't mean much as the hotel was under new management and our booking had been made at a cheap rate and they didn't have to honour it, but they said they would put us up in a flat next door to the hotel and it was an upgrade. We were so tired we said OK to this,until we got next door and saw the bedding! The pillows were all stained yellow with mould on them and the quilt which was sticking out the end of the cover was all disintegrating and mouldy looking. There was no tea,coffee milk etc at all and only a pershed old dishcloth on the sink. We went back and said we couldn't sleep in those beds. They relented and said we could have 1 night in the hotel and they would try somewhere else the next day. The hotel was better but still an old perished dishcloth on the sink the bathroom wasn't very clean. We were thankful though at this stage just for a bed. We were told we had to leave our luggage in the lobby the next morning and come back in the afternoon to see what they had found. Got back late in the afternoon to be told nothing else was available. It was either the flat next door or nothing. We said in desperation as long as they changed the bedding we would stay there. After all that we turned on the TV to find the only channels were arabic. Told reception, she didn't believe us until coming over and trying for herself. They did at least end up getting a technician in to install an aerial. I would say avoid this hotel at all costs. They really didn't seem to care at all about the fact that we had made a booking and paid in full. I'd say they do this on a regular basis, double booking rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good value not great”
Reviews.Author: stan_ttcc
Reviews.Content: Considering the price of London hotels this was a good value. Excellent location with shops and tube nearby. Clean room, but small. Bathroom poor. Could not adjust shower head so that it does not flow on your head. Took several days to get the tv working with 19 channels in lieu of 5. Hotel had lift and AC. Ask for room on 4th floor as the ceilings are slanted giving the impression of more room. Room had a fridge, dishes, etc. Helpful for a quick breakfast before leaving to tour.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny space but clean”
Reviews.Author: SjokoladeYesPlease
Reviews.Content: Great location for us. A little pricey but a decent rate for the area. The room was tight and cozy (i.e., small) but clean. My bathroom seemed newly renovated and spotless, but a friend in a different room complained that her shower was dirty. Towels and linens were very clean. Only complaint: my room was on the first floor, right next to a utility shed, so I would occasionally hear employees enter/exit the shed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, we will be back”
Reviews.Author: 186424Sharon
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Beds were absolutely amazing as they have memory foam toppers on the mattresses. Bathroom was small but was very clean and had new fittings and shower was excellent. Carpets could do with cleaning or renewing and fridge was a bit smelly but overall it was excellent value for money. We were in a basement room right next to a big fan outside (Room 606) and I was worried it would keep us awake but once the window was closed you couldnt hear a thing. Very friendly and helpful staff too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but wont be back”
Reviews.Author: sarahmatt03
Reviews.Content: The girl on check in was friendly, no directions to rooms, no information about breakfast or check out the next day. Room was clean - a bit tight around the bed, shower room small but clean. Had a balcony which was nice as we could go out on it - no view though as it faces out to the road and to the hotels opposite. Given directions to Bayswater station which were wrong, manage to find it after asking someone! We arrived back very late and asked the night shift what time breakfast was, he answered uncertainly 8.30 - 9.30. At 8.30 the following morning someone knocked on the door with what you might call breakfast. Luckily enough we were awake. Breakfast consisted of 2 boxes of Special K (which we both dont like) two cold croissants, butter and jam, two cartons of orange juice and a 1 litre bottle of milk. Had we been told about breakfast coming to the room and being able to choose the cereal it might not have been so bad. Our friend next door didnt get hers delivered until she had talked to us then rang down to Reception. There is only the desk and one chair in the room so eating a croissant sat on a bed left lots of crumbs - we were leaving that morning anyway so I wasnt bothered. Wont be staying there again, although the road it is situated on is quiet the breakfast in the room really put us off.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, dirty, dirty.”
Reviews.Author: Aneetah
Reviews.Content: I wasn't really sure if I should give this hotel 1 or 2 points out of 5, but because I'm a light sleeper and still slept really well and the interior design is fairly modern and OK (not really nice but just fine) I feel generous enough to give them 2 points. When we arrived, the shower had not been cleaned since I don't even know when, the shower glass doors were dirty from top to bottom and there was pubic hairs not just in the shower but also on the outside bottom of the toilet. Mmmm. When I booked it, I thought it would be nice to have a little kitchen and I was pleasantly surprised to find cups, glasses etc in the closet. I just wish they weren't dirty. We told the receptionists about this the first day, and they said they would send someone to fix it the next day (and still no apologies, I might add). The following night after the housekeeper had been there, the rest of the room had been tidied up and perhaps even cleaned but the shower glass doors and cups/glasses in the kitchen had not been touched. We checked out the next morning and told the staff, still no apologies, she said she simply had to go see it for herself to believe it because she knew the housekeeper had been there so it didn't sound very likely. Also, the shower was extremely tiny with really low water pressure... and I usually don't even care about these things. Too bad, because this hotel had a lot of potential.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: MissN87
Reviews.Content: I took my partner to London for a surprise birthday trip, and the Hyde Park Hotel really made it extra special! Upon check-in, the receptionist was very friendly and happily answered any questions we threw at her regarding London. Our room was on the second floor and my word, what a room! Once we opened the door we were greeted with a wonderful floor to ceiling window and a split level floor plan. The room was spotless and the bathroom, be it very small, offered a fantastic shower, just what we needed after a long day of exploring. Throughout our two night stay, all the staff were very courtious and friendly, including a nice gentleman who we believed to be the night porter, who told us the history of the hotel and the neighbourhood. The hotel is literally a stones throw from Bayswater Station and a number of shops, pubs and restaurants. The same can be said of Hyde Park and Kensington Gardens. The location is fantastic and gave me the impression Mary Poppins may walk out of one of the neighbouring buildings! Both myself and my partner work in the hotel industry, with a very high standard of what we wish to expect from other hotels. This one exceeded our expectations, enough to make me want to review it....We will be back! Thank you! :)

Reviews.Title: “Correct for this price”
Reviews.Author: BennyAn
Reviews.Content: The Hyde Park Hotel is one of those 'value for money'-hotels: not very memorable, but still a place where you get what you pay for (and those hotels are sometimes hard to find in big cities like London). The room I had was quite small (because of the double bed and kitchenette), my collegue had a slightly bigger room (but not more expensive). I never cooked in the room because the kitchen is really (really!) close to the bed, but the fridge was a nice thing to have (for some food & drinks). Bathroom was okay (clean enough, but with a very small shower). If you are not really a big person, it will be just fine though. WiFi was not always that good on the 4th floor: the connection was a bit weak sometimes, so one time I had to climb down some floors and sit on the stairs, where the connection was better. The location was okay for me: a very nice and safe neighbourhood, no problem walking there at night. It's a 10 to 15 min walk to the nearest Underground station. Overall: not a bad place to stay at all if you're looking for a decent, but not too expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and Hip”
Reviews.Author: designercowgirl
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Very close to Bayswater Tube station. Recently remodeled architecture and furniture. Terrific bathroom with kitchenette. We stayed four nights and had a lovely experience. Not elegant but comfortable and perfect for small family. Additionally, free wireless internet!

Reviews.Title: “excellent place”
Reviews.Author: tambi_10
Reviews.Content: this place is lovely couldnt fault it at all, we stayed there tuesday the 22nd for my partners birthday i read reviews first and booked it my partner knew nothing at all about going to london so i was a bit nerves he would like it., but he did and so did i it was clean polite staff and in a lovely location we will defentley be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Iordanis
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel in march 2011. Its location is excellent. The nearest tube station is bayswater (circle and district lines) and few meters further queensway (central line). In addition there's a bus station very close to the hotel from where you can catch bus no 7 which can take you directly to oxford street or the british museum. The rooms were clean, it seems they had been refurbished recently. I didn't have any breakfast included, but there was instant coffee and tea provided in the room which you could make it by yourself. The rooms were a bit small, especially the bathroom but what you could expect for £50 per night:) the other negative was that they gave us a room at the lower ground floor, with a small window which was a bit depressive.I would definetely visit it again. There's also a wifi in the hotel but the internet connection was too slow. In the room there was a large lcd tv screen, but its place on the wall wasn't very easy to watch when lying in bed. I've uploaded some photos as well, check them out

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: sanj1983
Reviews.Content: I can not speak highly enough of my stay at the Hyde Park Hotel. The Hotel staff were always very pleasant and happy to help. The Hotel is very clean as are the rooms and are comfortable to relax in especially after a long day walking in Central London.

Reviews.Title: “Jolly Good - I Feel Like a Savvy Traveler”
Reviews.Author: thats9countriesnow
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved this place. Just what we were looking for. Great neighborhood - we don't have these kind of hotels in Indiana! Very friendly staff too. By the way, tons of authentic restaurants in the area for our romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Best rate and a comfortable Victorian neighborhood feel”
Reviews.Author: Bothbusinessleisure
Reviews.Content: As an American, I found the cozy hotel area to be charming and close to all the attractions of the West End. Victorian on the outside - which makes me think of London - but modern on the inside - which I look for in travel. Front Desk staff was very helpful too. Next time I come back, I'll stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern room in a great location”
Reviews.Author: lisschris
Reviews.Content: We had the room next to reception which we thought might be a problem, however the only noise we heard came from the street. The rooms, although typically small, were extremely clean, modern and certainly comfortable. Small but efficient bathroom and the kitchenette was very handy to have although a few more utensils would be great. Location - EXCELLENT. Two tube stations to choose from (Queensway and Bayswater), and no more than 10 minutes to the heart of it all. For the price, certainly a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok if not to mention 10 minutes walk to tube twice a day...”
Reviews.Author: LamanVJ
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in the Hyde Park hotel in October 2010. The hotel itself is quite nice, rooms are small but not shabby, looking as they have recently been refurbished, left overall feeling of freshness and cleanliness. Bayswater as a location is great, easy access to everything and 24hr buses to the area BUT the hotel is much further from the station than it seems onthe map. It is actualy 10 minutes walk by the streets looking all the same way. For me personally it was tough and that's why I've got lost so many times on the way back to the hotel (probably it is all my topographic cretinism, but comment may be valuable for people who struggle with topography). It was quite cool outside so the room was not warm as their heating system didn't work. We immediately got the small heater from receiption. Overall staff is very nice, with heater, iron, directions and numerous questions we've asked they were always friendly and willing to help. There is a very comfortable service in the hotel - they can order a shuttle bus to Heathrow for 12gbp only, it is cheaper then tube and definitely much more comfortable. They have small "office" corner where you can check you email and they also allow you to print out with no charge. It was a pleasant experience inside the hotel but if you could move it a little bit closer to the tube/bus stop...

Reviews.Title: “Like staying in an Ikea showroom”
Reviews.Author: inkedman
Reviews.Content: After a very long walk from Lancaster Gate tube station we eventually found our hotel...we were greeted (loosely speaking) by a less than enthusiastic receptionist.We knew about the hotel before we arrived so certain things were not a suprise...no restaurant etc...but there were a few things that were less than satisfactory. Faulty aircon..the rooms can get very stuffy (they're not the biggest anyway),yes you can open the window but as we found every night 'til about 4am you get foreign students/tourists (who seem to be nocturnal!) having loud conversations in the street! The rooms are as my title suggests straight out of an Ikea catalogue,don't get me wrong I actually like Ikea furniture but it did feel a bid odd that everything in the room was straight out of the catalogue! The standard double rooms were tiny,and the beds...very uncomfortable( I woke up with a bad back every morning!) The kitchenette...completely unnecessary,it just takes up too much room. On the plus side the rooms were cleaned every day and the actual area of Bayswater was very nice with loads of great places to eat if you don't want to venture into the City every night. One tip I would suggest is that if you don't want a trek every day to get to the tube,then maybe stay a bit closer to the action (which I know means more money,but may be worth it),but then you could always get a Taxi which are always available,they'll take you to Oxford Street for around £10

Reviews.Title: “amazing location, easy going staff and we had a lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: matawale
Reviews.Content: small rooms, although my colleagues had bigger rooms but had everything i needed. very helpfull staff, simple and straight to the pont. this is a lovely little hottle where you don't expect much but you get enough. some beds hard, but i don't mind as i like had beds for my back.... see for yoursell, don't let anyone decide for you when you have the right to try

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was fine for the price but the hardest beds I've ever come across can be found here”
Reviews.Author: BurnleyLad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very reasonable for the money you pay. It's in a quiet area and the staff were very helpful. The very real problem was, as other reviewers have pointed out, ..the bed. This was the most uncomfortable bed in the world, I don't mind a firm bed but this was just awful. Rock hard is not an exaggeration If the management is reading this please give serious consideration to changing the beds, the hotel is quite good but I would not want to stay again whilst those beds are in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “I would prefer to sleep on a snooker table”
Reviews.Author: LondonVictoria78
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location and whilst it has no amenities, the size of the room and the bathroom are adequate. However, there is absolutely no explanation for the bed. Quite literally the most uncomfortable bed I have ever slept in. The floor or a table would been better! As a family with back problems we are used to hard mattresses but this actually shocked me. Don't book this hotel if you want a decent nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “fab city break”
Reviews.Author: danandmark
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my birthday weekend, the rooms maybe small however, your in the best city in the world people get out there and see it. The room was clean and fumctional but plenty big enough for 2. Its in easy reach of everything and we walk to most of our locations around the city, only getting a cab to and from the club at stupid oclock in the morning. Didn't eat here we were room only but would def stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Carolinde
Reviews.Content: I generally stay in hotels all over the world about five or six times a year, but this was my worst hotel experience ever. The Hyde Park makes Fawlty Towers look like a flawless five-star hotel. Late July I decided to spend 5 nights in London in August. It was difficult to find a hotel. Then The Hyde Park appeared to have vacancies. NOW I understand why........I sent them an e-mail about 9 days before I arrived, asking for a room on the top floor. When I arrived I was given a room in the basement; it was dark and cold and smelly and had only one tiny window. After one night I could move to a room on the first floor for the next 4 nights. It was very small. I kept knocking my elbows against everything! There was hardly room to put my suitcase down. The bed was very very hard. The maid forgot to give me clean towels, but had taken away the used ones...........In the room above me there were wooden floors and some very loud people. Apart from that there was a generator or something like that outside. And when someone somewhere in the hotel turned on the water tap, it sounded like a plane was taking off. So I was lucky to get some sleep between 2.30 and 6.30 a.m. I was exhausted! On the last day I had to leave for the airport quite early; reception forgot my wake-up call. Two positive points: one: the location of the hotel is great, not far from Queensway where there are two underground stations. Two: I try to look on the bright side; from now on all hotel experiences can only be better!

Reviews.Title: “if you want more than just a room,dont go!!!! no bar, no restaurant,no lounge.no nothing!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: elliemay19
Reviews.Content: was led to believe that this was a 4*..........no way!!!!! continental breakfast consisted of stale croissant,box cheerios n pint of milk, delivered to your room because no breakfast room, no lounge no bar, just expected to sit on your bed and eat it!!!!! would NEVER go back n would NOT reccomend

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated - but they did not get it right”
Reviews.Author: misteracdc
Reviews.Content: Here are my comments in a nutshell: Pros: - Good location within easy reach of public transport, shops and restaurants - For central London a surprisingly quiet location - Newly done up and quite tastefully so (if you like a more modern style) Cons: - Small rooms - I had a basement room with damp/fungus on the wall above the skirting - No sound proofing; my room had a connecting door to another room and you could hear the person breathe next door. I thought I had someone in my room actually! And for sure the other person heard me breathing as well! - I got charged for breakfast (the room price included breakfast) but could not make use of it as they don't serve before 8:30 am. Too bad if you need to leave the hotel before that time. - Also unusual and maybe of interest if you travel with a few friends and colleagues: there is no breakfast room. Each guests gets their (continental) breakfast delivered to the room. So you are forced to have breakfast by yourself. All in all I would not stay here again - I paid 100 GPS for one night and was disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping on a slab of marble.”
Reviews.Author: Litlun17
Reviews.Content: While this hotel was reasonably clean and in quiet area, you can definitely do better for the money. For one thing, the bed in our room was absolutely rock hard; I'm sure the floor would have been much more comfortable. For another, when we checked in we immediately realized that there was running water trickling down the bathroom walls; when we reported this to the desk clerk, she shrugged and said that the man in the room above us was taking a shower--! There are many similar hotels in the area, so I advise staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Small, rock hard beds, bad service, no frills.”
Reviews.Author: dave_abz
Reviews.Content: We were going to an event in Hyde park and thought this would be good hotel. The photos on the website made it look great. They are misleading and make the rooms look big. Saying they were small would be an understatement. The bed was jammed in the corner which meant one person had to climb over the other to get out. The bathroom was a cupboard. You couldn't get changed after showering. The shower also felt like a coffin as it wax tiny and extremely dark. The bed was rock hard and the constant drone of the generator outside our window kept us up all night. The service, while being efficient was cold and unhelpful. All in all I would give this hotel miss and we won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “I would never stay here again through choice.”
Reviews.Author: fempisces
Reviews.Content: The company paid £125 per room per night 3 of us to stay. My room had no windows, no bedside lighting and frlt like a corridor. Breakfast consisted of 2 stale croissants and sugary cereal, which had to be consumed in the room on the bed as there were no dining facilities. When asked if they had a small box of cereal not covered in sugar I was informed they did not. The beds were too hard and as such sleep was poor and you might as well sleep on the floor. The staff were not the friendliest, but given the number of time I heard other guests complaining and shouting at them I am not surprised. Internet access in this hotel will cost a further £7 per day and I genuinly felt the whole place was a rip off. I would definately reccomend avoiding this hotel wherever possible, it isn't worth trying to obtain a complaints form or ask for an address to write to regarding any issues or comments you may have as they do not seem to care hence my last resort to write here and warn others instead of dealing with the hotel directly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Eline_K
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Hyde Park hotel form Friday morning till Monday evening, and I really enjoyed my stay! Like other people wrote in their reviews, the room was a bit small, but that didn't bother me at all. I didn't expect a huge room when travelling to central London, and it was more then big enough for me and my best friend. The rooms looked amazing. The beds were comfortable and the shower really nice! The location is absolutely great! Bayswater road is so much fun and full of great and not expansive restaurants. The underground station 'Bayswater' is closest by (a five minute walk). During our stay this station was closed on Saturday and Sunday, but literally one minute from 'Bayswater' is the station 'Queensway' which is on the central underground line, which will take you directly to central London. It took us about 15 minutes to get from the hotel to central London, so that was absolutely great! Overall I think you get a great deal for your money, and if I ever go to London again (and I probably will), I'll probably go to this hotel again. I'd definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tidy, SMALL ROOMS!!”
Reviews.Author: abs90
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed in London for his birthday, at first we found it very hard to find the hotel but as we stayed there we found it easier to locate places. The pros was that there is a little kitchen space, when i say little i mean TINY, u cant even open the fridge properly! BEDS - ROCK HARD! the bed we stayed in was very big and modern, it looked so comfy, but it was rock solid. 7 days later, i had back ache! Also there was a stove, but no pan and when i asked for a pan to cook pasta in she gave me a frying pan!!??! very close to oxford street, and hyde park, we had nice little walks through the park! LOCATION - EXCELLENT! price of the room was quite expensive but still the cheapest i could find! i guess thats what you get when u travel to London! restaurents close by were very nice and theres a variety too; mexican, BBQ food, theres a big shopping centre with a cinema inside, very expensive though! tesco close by as well so it was easy just to quickly nip to the shop. We also stayed on the bottom floor and there was a bit of noise outside which disturbed us in the mornings! overall nice stay, probably wouldnt stay again becasue of the rock hard beds!!

Reviews.Title: “Really small rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: charaAthens
Reviews.Content: Ok, the hotel was very clear. The maid was making our room every day....But the rooms were indeed very very small !! You could hardly move inside the room that is why we wanted ta spent every hour outside the room- eventhough we were very tired. The matress wes really hard to sleep on! We had to place blankets on is so as to sleep. The central heating wasn't working on th 4th floor and when I asked for more blankets he told me that THEY DID NOT HAVE BECAUSE THE HOTEL WAS FULLY BOOKED! Imagine what that means in London where temperature was approximately at 4 degrees celcius. What is more the hotel offer kitchenette but with decafeinated coffee!! The personnel was really helpful though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value London Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Celtica
Reviews.Content: Hotel is short walk from Bayswater underground-improving area with good shops and numerous places to eat and drink. All the main chains are here and a lot of arab and thai establishments, which looked nice. Also some nice looking pubs-an improving area it appeared. Took two rooms on third floor. (303/308) For the price £74 each they were exceptional value. Rooms modern and hotel was clean including rooms. Cleaning staff all over and busy fair play. Power shower good as was tv and small kitchen/mini bar. These rooms are really good value, with modern furniture and wooden floors. The size was also not a problem and more than enough with a desk and kitchenette. The reception were fine as was communication before hand. Based on this visit I would certainly book again and I was pleasantly surprised with everything. I am quite happy to slate bad service, but in all fairness I found the hotel way above my expectations. Other rooms may be different who knows but these were great. Small hotel making a go of it at really affordable prices.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD FOR DWARFS”
Reviews.Author: falcoaerospace
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because we wanted to stay near Hyde Park and we were looking for a hotel in a moddle range of price. This hotel is simply to avoid because: 1) The room and the bath were simply too little. You have to walk close to the wall to avoid the bed! The same think you can say about the bath!!! 2) The Rececption man who did the check in was really harsh. 3) They ask for money for everythink!!!: 5 GPB for the adapter of the cellular charger, 5 GBP to take the lugguage in the receprion the day of check out-absurd. In your interest---AVOID THIS HOTEL! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we needed it for”
Reviews.Author: kerz_yeah
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel whist going to the Wireless festival on Hyde Park - the location was good had a few shops around and Bayswater station really close. The rooms are very modern which are just the right size. The bathroom was clean but you could see where they havent been clean around all the nooks and crannies!!! a good thing about the bathroom was it had free Dove hand and shower gel which was nice ! If i was returning to this area i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolut Horror - It STINKS”
Reviews.Author: NormanBrighton
Reviews.Content: My parents and I booked the hotel in order for us to relax before running a Half - Marathon. We entered the room and it smelled of rotten eggs in the bathroom which eventually spread into the sleeping room. Everytime a guest above us flushed the toilet, the smell became more disgusting and revolting. The pipes of the old building were so loud and the walls are so thin that it was impossible to sleep. We tried to pick up the issue with the hotel staff but it's like talking to the wall.... there were not interested and when we asked for a refund we were only giving a 10% discount by a receptionist that could not say sorry ONCE for the whole experience. She kept on phoning her manager ZANA CUK who would not even talk to us. Even though that hotel could not provide us with the basic human needs like having a peaceful sleep, going to the toilett and we could even have shower in the morning because of the smell. After all that dissapointment we had to run a half marathon.... Whatever you do, don't stay in that hotel. Nobody cares if you even get a sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Would Return”
Reviews.Author: canOgrog
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a good hotel to stay in if you're on a tight budget but want a clean and modern hotel. Bizarrely, though, my trip there did not get off to a great start... I arrived at the hotel at around 00:30 and was greeted by the only negative element of our stay - a man void of any courtesy or acknowledgement that you are what's known as a guest. He looked like he'd been dragged out of a hedge sideways too. I don't normally judge people like this but when you work in a service-based industry you should always present yourself well. t felt as though I'd intruded into his living room. I had pre-paid for my stay through an online agent. He asked for my credit card which I, at the time, thought was normal, maybe in case I broke anything in the hotel. He took my credit card and said "£360 - is that OK?" I was a little stumped... "Err, but I've already paid this online!" In a very "don't mess with me" tone, he said "Nnnnno you haven't...". I certainly didn't have the funds to pay this a second time around and sort out later and I wondered what I'd got myself into. After some convincing (namely by showing him evidence of my receipt about four times over) and his mumblings about "some agents don't pay us" he gave me the keycard and told me he'd contact me if any payment needed to be sorted out. I was too tired at that time to even say "No you won't because there's nothing to discuss!" so I just went to my room. You could immediately tell that the hotel had been recently refurbished. The best I can describe it is a high end Ikea-like standard. The life and corridors were all new and it had a quality feel to the place - for a budget hotel. The room doors were thick and meaty. Upon entering my room I was immediately impressed. It's always a relief to walk into a hotel room for the first time and get the "thank God it's nice and clean and spacious" feeling! There was plenty of space around the beds and plenty of room for manoeuvre. Most London hotels are small but this was at the large end of small. The TV was a large flatscreen and came with all Freeview channels. Furniture-wise there was a desk, a chest of drawers and a wardrobe - standard in most hotels. All elements seemed relatively new. Not sure whether this is a good thing or a bad thing but there was a kitchenette in the room. Handy having a refrigerator but I doubt many people who tour London are going to be making BeanFeast in their room and I'm not so keen on the idea of having a kitchenette right next to my bed! I think the quality of the room was spoiled by this. The bed was not naff in any sense of the word but I'd agree with other reviewers that it was hard. It wasn't uncomfortable as such but I stayed here for five nights and I'll hold my hands up and say that I was glad to get back to my own bed after that length of time. The bathroom was small and cramped but if there's only one person in there then you can't really complain. I'd rather have a small refurbished bathroom than a larger dirty old bathroom. The shower cubicle was a tight fit although the water pressure was good. The view from the room was nice enough - buildings of the same height are situated across the road but they're certainly not an eye sore. You can view a leafy sqaure just to the left. It was nice to look out of the window and relax. Maids came to change our sheets on a bi-daily basis and the rest of the staff were courteous and helpful. The location is quite good - Bayswater tube station is only 5 minutes walk away and once you have Tube access you can get to anywhere in London very easily. Bayswater itself has plenty of restaurants and cafes to choose from, although you are really limiting yourself if you just stay in the area. We only saw the original guy who 'greeted' me on the second night of our stay. He was smoking in the porch area - and did not return our "Hello", but instead proceeded to loiter and stare at us. I suspect he is the owner but that place would be better off without him lingering around. He made us feel nervous. If it wasn't for him I'd probably have given this place 4 stars. The hotel itself is a great find if you're looking at a budget of around £70 per night. I'd certainly recommend it to friends.

HotelInfo.Name: The Hyde Park Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 23-25 Leinster Square - Bayswater, London W2 4NE, England
